intro: Conostylis crassinerva subsp. crassinerva, commonly known as the broad-leaved conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Conostylis crassinerva subsp. crassinerva is adapted to dry conditions and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant.
